The example embodiment aims to preserve the physical, aesthetic, and functional properties of the floors, providing increased durability and the ability for corrective maintenance. The method addresses drawbacks of conventional stave floors, offering a solution for maintaining the appearance and longevity of the floors.</summary>

<summary> The invention relates to ladder attachments that provide lateral stability, prevent damage to work surfaces, and allow the ladder to straddle corners. The attachments include large contact area braces with resilient pad assemblies that grip the work surface without causing damage. The braces are attached to the siderails of the ladder and can be adjusted to accommodate different sizes of ladders. The design allows for increased contact area with the work surface, preventing slipping and sliding. The attachments can be used on various types of ladders and are interchangeable between the left and right sides. Overall, the invention provides a solution to common ladder stability and surface damage issues. </summary>

<summary> The present invention pertains to a collated nail strip formed with a debris-free plastic material for use in a fastener driving tool. The plastic material is molded onto and adhered to the fasteners, reducing debris generation and increasing holding power. Various configurations of the collation system, including tapered collars, embossed patterns, and selectively weakened regions, are designed to minimize debris and enhance the performance of the fastener assembly. </summary>

<summary> The invention is a nozzle for applying sealants in multiple artifacts or machines, such as automobiles, trains, ships, and aircraft. It features a bell-shaped lower section and an injection button with channels and orifices for precise sealant application. The design allows for manual or automated sealant application, improving efficiency and quality in various industries. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a position sensor system for monitoring the position and movement of objects. The system includes a waveform generator, error correction generator, and sensor monitoring equipment for multiplexing multiple sensors on a minimum number of wires. The system eliminates static signals and error signals, constantly compares sensor output to a desired minimum value, and provides error correction to deliver accurate position signals. The system also includes a window reference circuit, a digitally stored offset and error correction closed-loop compensation, and a method for rapid recalibration due to sudden changes in offset voltage. Overall, the system reduces energy consumption, provides accurate position monitoring, and allows for easy recalibration. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a desmodromic valve actuation system for intake and exhaust functions in internal combustion engines. The system eliminates the need for springs and allows for infinitely variable valve displacement. By controlling the valve port opening percentage, the system can optimize engine performance and fuel consumption. The system consists of a rotating cam, translating means, and controllable actuating mechanisms for precise valve control. Computer control allows for efficient operation of individual cylinders based on vehicle performance. The system can be adapted for engines with multiple valves per cylinder, offering a simple, robust, and efficient solution for internal combustion engines. </summary>

<summary> The source document describes a light member for aquariums and other applications, using LEDs for lighting. The light member includes a housing with a top and bottom side, and a lighting control region on the bottom side with control channels for different colors of light. Modules with LEDs emitting white or blue light can be coupled to the lighting control region. The modules have electrical connectors that couple to the control channels. The light member can be controlled manually with switches, remotely with RF technology, or with in-line timers. The light member can also be used under cabinets, with multiple light members linked together in series. Optics elements can be added to the light member to change the angle or focus of the light emitted. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a cooled flow deflection apparatus for a fluid-flow machine operating at high temperatures, such as a gas turbine blade. The prior art involves casting cooling channels and separating walls, leading to disadvantages like thermal stresses and high blade weight. The invention introduces separate inserts for the separating walls, simplifying production and allowing for flexibility in design. The inserts are inserted into holders in the flow deflection apparatus and can be connected securely through material joints. The cooling fluid flows through the channels in opposite directions, deflected by U-shaped separating walls. The invention reduces thermal stresses, blade weight, and simplifies the cooling system adjustment. The approach is particularly beneficial for gas turbine blades, improving efficiency and simplifying production processes. The use of separate inserts enhances cooling efficiency and reduces the complexity of casting development. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a system and method for controlling a fuel delivery system for a vehicle, allowing for automatic or manual control. The system includes a control unit that processes signals indicating accelerator pedal position and throttle valve position to set the throttle for optimal performance. A DC motor or stepper motor is used to control the throttle valve based on the signals processed by the control unit. The system allows for smooth switching between automatic and manual control without causing the vehicle to lurch or stall. Manual control is achieved by engaging a clutch to connect the accelerator pedal directly to the throttle valve. The system ensures full operation of the vehicle in manual mode and does not compromise safety. The control system can also be used in conjunction with a continuously variable transmission for optimal performance. Various subroutines and logic sequencers are used to control the operation of the system. </summary>

<summary> The invention pertains to methods and apparatus for generating heat from particulate-laden gas or waste fuels like wood waste. Conventional hog fuel burners have been inefficient and polluting, requiring frequent cleaning and maintenance. The waste fuel burner described in the document aims to emit minimal particulate materials, operate with little slag or clinkers, and burn wet wood effectively. By utilizing primary and secondary combustion chambers with controlled air flow, the burner can achieve clean emissions and efficient combustion. The burner's unique design allows for quick response times, self-regulation, and the ability to burn a variety of fuels with high moisture content. Additionally, the burner can be adapted for various industrial applications beyond just waste fuel burning.</summary>

The invention pertains to evaporative refrigeration systems that cool air without adding water vapor, achieving sensible cooling. By utilizing return air from the load as the working fluid on the wet side of the heat exchanger, the system achieves high efficiency in cooling. A hybrid system is also described, where a portion of the cooled air is further cooled by a vapor compression refrigeration unit, resulting in dehumidification and increased cooling efficiency.

<summary> The document describes a fluid pump with multiple pump heads arranged in series to pump fluid from a reservoir. Each pump head contains an impeller driven by a common drive structure passing through the pump heads. The pump heads are connected by combiners to combine fluid flow before exiting the pump heads. The pump can be mounted on support structures like a wheeled boom, hitching assembly, or trailer for operation at a fluid reservoir. The design allows for modularity and ease of maintenance, with the ability to add more pump heads for increased operating pressure. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to engine compression release brakes for less than all engine cylinders, reducing excess components and improving engine robustness. The engine includes an engine housing with a plurality of cylinders, each having a movable piston and connected to hydraulically and mechanically actuated devices. A portion of the cylinders have engine compression release brakes connected to the exhaust valve for engine braking. The engine brake system includes a solenoid, valve members, and a piston to control the opening and closing of the exhaust valve during engine braking. The electronic control module determines the need for engine braking and activates the engine brakes for the desired cylinders. The engine brakes operate by blocking high pressure fluid flow to open the exhaust valve during the compression stroke of the piston. Once the desired engine braking is achieved, the engine brakes are deactivated, allowing the exhaust valve to close and the engine to continue normal operation. The modularity of the engine brake system allows for customization based on the required braking horsepower for specific applications. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a mounting link between an engine structure and an attached structure such as an auxiliary gearbox, designed to withstand extreme loads such as blade-off events. The link assembly includes a male link, a female link, and a pin to selectively retain the male and female links. The female link receives the male link to allow translation and forms a radial interface to dampen motion. The mounting link can absorb extreme shocks without detaching the gearbox from the engine. The pin serves as a fusible link that shears at a known load magnitude, allowing the female and male links to translate relative to each other. The radial interface provides coulomb damping to dissipate energy during translation. The use of the pin and coulomb damping eliminates the need for all linkages to withstand extreme loads, reducing weight and material requirements. The pin can be replaced during maintenance following any shock sufficient to break it. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to archery equipment and methods for attaching arrow points and balancing arrow shafts. The point cap system provides adjustable weight for perfect balance, reducing material and weight of arrow points. A balance pin can be adjusted to balance an arrow shaft, working in conjunction with the point cap. The invention also prevents dirt from entering the arrow shaft when arrow points are not attached. It utilizes external threads for arrow point attachment to reduce stress on the shaft. The point adaptor and nock cap provide additional support and attachment options for arrow shafts. The balance pin can be used with arrow points or point caps to adjust point weight. The invention allows for easy replacement of damaged components without rendering the arrow shaft useless. Overall, the invention improves the performance and durability of archery equipment. </summary>

<summary> The invention is a cost-effective pyrotechnic sound and flash simulator for small arms training, utilizing an electronically controlled system with plastic expendables containing pyrotechnic charges. The simulator provides a realistic simulation of small arms fire noise and flash without dangerous pressurization of the ignition chamber, offering a reliable, low-maintenance, and reusable training device. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to an air intake device for internal combustion engines that utilizes the dynamic effects of air flow to improve engine performance while reducing noise. The device includes a tank, two pipes interconnecting the tank with the air intake passage, and a valve with an actuator responsive to engine operating conditions. The cross-sectional area of the second pipe is smaller than the first pipe, and the second pipe opens closer to the air cleaner than the first pipe. The valve is controlled based on engine speed and load to optimize engine performance. The narrow passage in the second pipe acts as a resonator to absorb intake noise. The valve operation is determined by the intersection of volumetric efficiency curves and engine load conditions. The valve is preferably closed at low engine speeds and loads, and opened at higher speeds and loads. The control circuit produces a control signal for the valve based on engine speed and throttle position sensors. </summary>

<summary> The invention is a two-part bracket for mounting speakers or equipment to poles, flat surfaces, or other structures. It allows for easy installation by one person and can be used on surfaces of different sizes. The bracket assembly consists of a stationary bracket and an adjustable bracket, with tapered springs guiding them together. The adjustable bracket can be rotated into a locked position and secured with screws for permanent use. For pole mounting, adapters and a clamp assembly are used to secure the bracket to the pole. A speaker mounting bracket can be attached to the adjustable bracket for mounting speakers. Overall, the invention provides a simple and efficient solution for mounting objects on various surfaces. </summary>

<summary> The present disclosure relates to a burner for heat utilizing appliances, with a focus on efficiency and clean burning. The burner includes a combustion chamber enclosed by an outer wall surrounding a fuel holder, with air flowing through the fuel holder and around it to support combustion. A shroud provides a flow path for tertiary combustion air and an external surface that remains cool to the touch. The burner also features legs for support, a pivotally coupled ash pan, a perforate food grate, and a cover for safety. Modular heat utilizing appliances can be attached to the burner using manual couplings, including closed and open cookers, a food smoker, a space heater, and a pyrolyzer. The system allows for diverse heat utilizing appliances to be used with a single burner, providing efficiency and convenience. </summary>

<summary> Rotary internal combustion engines face challenges with cooling systems, particularly in the area surrounding spark plugs where uneven heating can lead to housing distortion. In-line spark plug arrangements disrupt cooling flow, leading to vapor collection and heat retention. The invention aims to improve combustion efficiency and cooling characteristics to prevent structural failures. By staggering spark plug bosses in the cooling passageway, high velocity flow is controlled and heat transfer coefficients are increased. Tests show that staggered configurations result in better flow regimes and higher heat transfer rates compared to in-line arrangements. The offset of spark plug terminals on the trochoid surface allows for close in-line arrangement while preventing vapor collection. The staggered boss configuration promotes separate paths for vapor release during boiling heat transfer. Overall, the invention enhances cooling performance and reduces the risk of thermal distortion in rotary engine housings. </summary>

<summary> The present invention is a method of using control valve positions as feedback to minimize flow disturbance caused by the closing and reopening of turbine control valves during periodic operational testing. By maintaining total mass flow through parallel control valves constant, steam boiler pressure and turbine power changes are minimized, resulting in improved performance without the need for additional process parameter monitoring. </summary>

<summary> The invention is a mixing valve for combining fluids from two separate sources into one mixture, specifically designed for an aircraft cleaning apparatus. The valve allows for a range of mixture compositions from 0% to 100% of each fluid. The valve body has two inlets for soap solution and water, and one outlet for the mixed solution. The valve system includes a spool valve with various components for controlling the flow and mixture proportions. The valve allows for continuous adjustment of the mixture strength by rotating a handle to change the proportions of soap solution and water. The design ensures constant fluid pressures at the inlets, even when multiple valves are operated from the same sources. The valve system provides a solution for aircraft cleaning tasks, allowing users to control the cleaning solution's strength. The detailed description includes the components, operation, and benefits of the mixing valve system for aircraft cleaning. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a method of compressing gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline, particularly in permanent frost areas. The method involves compressing the gas to a higher pressure, cooling it, and feeding it back into the pipeline with a lower exit temperature and increased exit pressure. The invention aims to reduce investments and operational risks. The method includes compressing the gas to an excess pressure, cooling it through heat exchange, and expanding it to the desired exit pressure. The compressor station includes compressors, heat exchangers, valve-controlled pipelines, and electronic controls. The method allows for efficient operation throughout the year, with different configurations for summer and winter operation. The use of expansion turbines for pressure reduction and energy recovery is recommended. The invention offers cost savings, increased plant availability, and reduced safety risks compared to conventional cooling methods.</summary>

<summary> The document discusses the use of cooling fans to prevent overheating of electronic components in various applications. It introduces a system for eliminating traditional fasteners used to secure cooling fans to enclosures, reducing costs and labor. The system involves mounting the cooling fan assembly to a panel using resilient legs that compress and rotate to securely hold the fan in place. The document concludes by stating that modifications can be made to the system without departing from the spirit of the invention. </summary>

<summary> The invention describes a damped kinematic mount design for spacecraft instruments to reduce vibration levels during flight, incorporating novel damping features to dissipate energy and protect instruments from damage. The design uses vibration damping materials in the mounts to achieve significant levels of damping, improving performance and reducing loads transmitted to the instrument. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a clutch unit for large power transmission requirements, particularly in aircraft catapult systems. The clutch unit includes interleaved clutch plates and discs, with separate piston and cylinder means for each set to minimize residual drag. The unit also utilizes hydraulic fluid for cooling and retraction of the clutch plates. The clutch discs are segmented for easy removal and replacement without disassembling the entire unit. The system includes a servo control valve, first and second stage fluid amplifiers, and a main and auxiliary fluid supply for controlling the clutch operation. The design allows for maximum torque transmission, improved cooling, and reduced residual drag, making it suitable for high horsepower applications. The invention provides a novel and improved clutch unit with various features to enhance performance and reliability. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a combined engine system with combustion cylinders and downstream expansion cylinders to maximize thermal-to-mechanical efficiency and reduce heat loss. Water injection, gearing optimization, water recovery systems, and catalytic materials are incorporated to enhance performance and reduce emissions. The system aims to lower exhaust gas temperature to eliminate the need for a radiator, while maximizing energy extraction. Various configurations and components are described to achieve high efficiency and reduced environmental impact. </summary>

<summary> The invention concerns the fabrication of plates or blanks of coated steel for welding and heat treatment to achieve parts with good mechanical characteristics and corrosion resistance. The method involves removing the metal alloy layer from the periphery of the plate before welding to prevent the formation of intermetallic areas. By maintaining an intermetallic alloy layer in the welded joint, the method ensures good ductility and corrosion resistance in the final part. The process involves coating the steel plate, removing the metal alloy layer, welding the plates, heat treating, and cooling to achieve the desired mechanical properties and corrosion resistance. </summary>

<summary> The present invention is a SCADA system for remote control and navigation of a mobile structure that optimally recovers energy from severe weather patterns. The system includes algorithms for efficiency optimization, data collection from various sources, and human interaction through a graphical user interface. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a rolling body guide cage made from at least two flat material ring segments joined and welded together to reduce cutting waste during manufacturing. The ring segments are punched out from sheet metal material and welded along joint contours to form engagement zones. The method involves welding the ring segments together before forming the axial profiling, resulting in reduced production costs. The ring element can be used to create various types of rolling body guide cages, such as ball bearing cages and needle bearing cages, by forming the cage structure from the welded ring element. </summary>

<summary> The present methods and systems utilize global satellite positioning to facilitate processing and transmission of information associated with telecommunications service locations. Efficient customer service is crucial in the telecommunications industry to maintain market share. Methods and systems are needed to acquire latitude and longitude coordinates of customer service locations to improve response time. The system includes an input device for service technicians, a technician server, a GPS system, a dispatch system, an address guide system, and a customer records system. The GPS system tracks service technicians and obtains coordinates of customer service locations. The system also includes a mapping system to provide driving directions between customer service locations. Computer-readable media embodiments are provided for these methods and systems. Various components can be replaced or combined to perform functions, and examples are provided for illustration purposes. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields using two sensors and a digital processor. Feedback control systems are commonly used to compensate magnetic fields, with sensors measuring the amplitude of the interfering field. Helmholtz coils are often used to generate homogeneous compensation fields. The system processes signals from the sensors to create virtual sensor signals representing the amplitude of the interfering field at the object's location. Control loops then transform these signals to control the coils for field compensation. The system can compensate both homogeneous and inhomogeneous magnetic fields. Feedback effects between two systems operating in close proximity are accounted for using a feedback matrix. Experimental determination of the feedback matrix elements is possible for accurate compensation.</summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a method for investigating a sample using CARS microscopy, where a resonance signal is generated by coherent anti-Stokes Raman scattering. The method involves furnishing at least one resonance site through a bioorthogonal reaction of an intrinsic chemical structure of the sample with a reaction partner. Bioorthogonal reactions are chemical reactions that can proceed in living systems without interfering with natural processes. The method allows for the introduction of resonance sites into a sample that does not inherently possess them, improving specificity and increasing scattering cross section. By tagging non-resonant background with resonance sites, a reproducible counter-stain can be generated, enhancing the reproducibility of CARS methods. The method combines the advantages of multi-photon techniques with selective reactions, enabling targeted detection of specific molecules in samples. </summary>

<summary> The invention provides a system for assessing segmentations in radiation therapy. It compares segmentations from different sources, such as a gold standard segmentation and a segmentation from a less experienced clinician or autosegmentation program. The comparison process involves converting segmentations to volume models and identifying common, missing, and extra volume elements. A measurement metric is used to evaluate the conformance between the segmentations. The metric method can be customized by the user, with parameters for weighting volume elements based on distance. The system displays the comparison results visually, showing common, missing, and extra volume elements in different colors. It also provides quantitative evaluations, including primary and secondary volumes, missing and extra volumes, and the metric score. The system can be used for training clinicians, quality assurance of autosegmentation routines, and assessing new imaging technology. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to accelerating the effective subtraction operation in floating point operations by calculating a subset difference in operand exponent arguments. This subset difference allows for the initiation of the subtraction of operand fractions before the complete difference between exponent arguments is determined. By selecting the subset carefully, the correct resulting fraction can be identified even if the current procedure is incorrect. The apparatus includes detection and logic units to determine the correct final fraction result based on the subset and complete differences in exponent arguments. The operation accelerates the computation by starting the process before the complete difference is known, ensuring that the final fraction result is available or in progress when needed. The technique reduces the time required for executing floating point operations and improves the efficiency of data processing systems. </summary>

The invention relates to a method of tracking specimens collected from patients in a medical facility using unique machine-readable codes on patient ID bands, order forms, specimen containers, and blood drawer badges. The method involves storing and comparing these codes in a computer system to ensure accurate specimen collection and processing, reducing the risk of mislabeling errors. The system provides a failsafe process for identifying and processing patient specimens, eliminating the need for vial labels and reducing associated costs.

<summary> The invention is a voice-activated distance measuring device, particularly for golfers, that uses GPS and voice recognition technology to provide distance and other information verbally. The device can be incorporated into headgear, such as a hat, and includes features like bone conductance vibration sensors, Bluetooth technology, and the ability to record and share golf course data. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to semiconductor design technology, specifically in implementing circuit designs into silicon-based integrated circuits. Design rule checks (DRC) are used to ensure compliance with topological layout rules. Conventional methods for checking design rules in system-on-chip (SOC) designs often result in false errors and overlook real errors. The invention provides a system and method for accurately detecting errors in logic and memory regions by creating customized design rules based on modifying standard logic rules. This approach eliminates false errors and speeds up the design development cycle. The system categorizes errors by different regions on the chip, such as logic, SRAM, and ROM groups. The invention can be applied to various industries beyond semiconductor manufacturing. </summary>

<summary>Waveguide holograms are used for controlled illumination of objects with specific requirements, such as holograms and spatial light modulators. They provide high diffraction efficiencies and occupy less space compared to conventional lens systems. However, they may suffer from alignment sensitivity, nonuniformity of diffracted wavefronts, and two-sidedness issues. Compensation methods include exposing a photographic emulsion to correct nonuniformity and using off-axis illumination to prevent light from entering the optical system. Different recording configurations can be used to create waveguide holograms, with experiments showing successful illumination of objects with coherent light sources. The invention allows for selective and efficient illumination of demanding objects, with potential for further improvements and applications beyond the examples provided.</summary>

<summary> The invention relates to testing squirrel cage rotors for induction motors to detect defects. The apparatus includes test heads with exciting means, voltage sensing means, current sensing means, and processing means. The method involves magnetizing the rotor, sensing induced voltages, and determining resistance, reactance, and effective skew. The test heads have primary windings, voltage pick-up coils, and skew pick-up coils. The data acquisition and processing system acquires and processes data to determine resistance, reactance, and skew values. The control processor compares the values to predetermined thresholds and provides pass/fail determinations. Statistical information is stored for analysis, and the results are displayed and printed for evaluation.</summary>

<summary> The document describes a method for securing a mobile device by granting access to native resources to managed libraries with validated digital certificates, while denying access to managed applications without proper authorization. The process involves receiving a package, identifying executables, verifying managed metadata for type-safe code, and storing the verified executable in a digitally signed container. The container is then transmitted to a mobile device, ensuring that the executable includes managed dependencies and is authorized to access premium native system resources. The process also involves validating digital signatures associated with the runtime host and manager, executing the runtime host, and determining the trust level of the managed application before granting access to native system resources. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to an improved identification card with an internal antenna and integrated circuit chip laminated between protective layers. The card is designed to protect electronic components from damage and is constructed using a core layer, bottom sheet, adhesive layers, and polymer layers. The process involves pre-shrinking materials, printing fixed and variable indicia, bonding layers, and applying protective layers. The resulting identification card offers improved durability, ease of manufacture, and protection for the electronic components.</summary>

<summary> The invention relates to implementing a FIFO queue in a memory using a tree-shaped structure. Updates are made by copying the path from the root to the point of updating. A header node is added to the structure to improve efficiency, allowing for faster additions and deletions. The header node includes an inversion bit to indicate the direction of the queue. The queue can be inverted in constant time and space. The structure allows for symmetrical use as a double-ended queue. The memory arrangement includes control logic, intermediate registers, and a flag register to maintain the queue. The invention provides a more efficient way to implement a FIFO queue in a memory. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to embedded EPROM devices manufactured using existing IC technologies, such as DRAM technology. By utilizing DRAM storage capacitors as coupling capacitors, EPROM devices can be built on the same wafer as DRAM devices without adding cost to manufacturing procedures. The EPROM devices of the present invention have higher gate coupling ratios and lower operation voltages compared to current art EPROM devices. Additionally, the invention introduces stress effect programmable read only memory (SEPROM) devices, which store data by utilizing transistor damages caused by electrical stresses. SEPROM devices offer advantages such as low cost, high data storage capacity, and security features, but may have limitations in re-programmability and writing speed. Overall, the invention provides practical methods for building EPROM devices using existing IC technologies and opens up possibilities for novel applications.</summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a method of determining feedback gain for feedback control systems. The method involves provisionally determining feedback gain values, executing feedback control, calculating evaluation values based on error detection, and repeating the process to determine suitable feedback gain values. Evaluation functions are used to evaluate the stability, accuracy, and response of the control system, and the optimum values of the P, I, and D gains are determined based on these functions. The method can be applied to various control systems, such as automatic guidance vehicles, and allows for quick and accurate determination of feedback gain values. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to zoom lenses with increased relative aperture and good optical performance over the entire zooming range, while minimizing physical size for use in photographic and video cameras. By satisfying specific conditions for the construction and arrangement of lens elements, the invention achieves a reduction in size while preserving high-grade optical performance throughout the zooming range. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a method and device for detecting elementary particles in a detector. The method involves discharging charge pulses on the low-voltage side, amplifying individual signals in a fast amplifier, and integrating signals in a slow amplifier. The device includes a support capacitor for compensating rapid discharging of the detector and enables detection of both individual particles and integration of signals. This technology has applications in scientific research, medical diagnostics, and electrical power engineering. </summary>

<summary> The invention is an apparatus for automatically spin checking driven disc assemblies used in friction clutches. The apparatus includes an enclosure with stationary and movable rings, a torque motor connected to a splined hub for rotating the driven disc assembly, and sensors for measuring distances and rotation. The apparatus operates automatically without manual involvement, determining if the driven disc assembly is good or bad based on measurements taken during the testing process. The control system includes a microprocessor, control switches, and a display for providing feedback to the operator. The apparatus is efficient, providing external indications of the test results and allowing for statistical process control. The invention improves the testing process for driven disc assemblies, ensuring they meet specified tolerances. </summary>

The present invention relates to face age-estimation methods using a contourlet appearance model algorithm. The method involves extracting facial features from an image, mapping these features to different age groups, and using support vector regression and support vector machines for classification. The system utilizes a training database of landmarked faces to generate aging functions and an age classifier, which are then used to estimate the age of a subject's face represented in image data. The system can provide estimated ages with corresponding confidence factors and can be implemented on a computing system with various input and output devices.

<summary> The present invention relates to a matrix display device for displaying two merged images, preserving the definition of the image with higher resolution. The device consists of a matrix of pixels organized in arrangements, with some pixels dedicated to displaying the first image and others dedicated to displaying the second image, resulting in a merged display of both images. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a mobile identification transmitter for a motor vehicle security system, with a removable payment element in a housing receptacle. The payment element can be used for cashless transactions and is protected by a closure in the secure state. The payment element communicates with the payment system and can be removed for use, while the closure seals the receptacle to prevent damage. The identification transmitter can also communicate with the security system of the vehicle, providing enhanced functionality for the user. Energy storage devices supply power to the electronics and payment element, ensuring seamless operation. </summary>

<summary> An imaging device, such as a xerographic machine, may become inactive and enter a sleep mode to save energy. However, prolonged inactivity can lead to a decrease in the tribo charge of the toner, affecting image quality. To address this, methods and apparatuses for charging toner based on periods of inactivity are proposed. These methods involve determining user usage patterns, predicting next usage cycles, measuring toner charge levels, and adjusting toner charge levels to ensure consistent image quality. The intelligent toner charging system described can be implemented in software or hardware, providing a solution to maintaining optimal toner charge levels in imaging devices. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a rotary magnetic head type apparatus capable of controlling the recording and reproduction of signals by plural heads with high precision. The apparatus includes MR heads, bias current circuits, regenerative amplifiers, and recording heads mounted on a rotary drum. Control signals are generated on the stationary drum side and transmitted to the rotary side via rotary transformers. The control signals regulate bias currents for MR heads, switch between regenerative amplifiers, and control recording currents for recording heads. The apparatus allows for independent regulation of bias currents for MR heads and recording currents for recording heads, ensuring stable data recording and reproduction. The invention can be applied to various types of recording/reproducing apparatuses with multiple heads, providing high precision control and efficient data transmission.</summary>

<summary> The invention is concerned with locating and tracing concealed elongated conductive objects, such as pipes or cables, in the presence of adjacent objects. The prior art techniques involve passive magnetic locators and active transmitters to induce currents in objects for tracing. The present invention improves the ease and accuracy of locating and tracing concealed objects by using a transmitter with two antennae to induce distinguishable currents in adjacent objects. The method involves producing distinguishable currents in the objects, moving a receiver sensitive to magnetic fields associated with the currents, and producing an output signal dependent on both fields. The system can produce two distinct output signal nulls over respective objects, making it easier to locate and trace one object even in the presence of adjacent objects. Different techniques can be used to make the currents distinguishable and produce an output signal dependent on both currents. The transmitter and receiver apparatus are designed to work together to optimize the tracing process, with the transmitter being positioned to induce currents in the objects and the receiver detecting the magnetic fields associated with the currents. The invention is especially useful when the horizontal separation between objects is related to the depth of the object to be located and traced. Overall, the invention provides an improved system and method for locating and tracing concealed objects in the presence of adjacent objects. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to an apparatus for interfacing a speaker phone with a telephone network to enable hands-free automatic answering and communication. It includes a timer for controlling the length of time of the interconnection and a bypass switch for extending the call duration. The apparatus can be used in various settings, such as for the physically handicapped or in business environments, and can be easily connected to existing telephone systems. Two embodiments are described, one electronic and one electromechanical, each providing the capability for automatic answering and hands-free communication with a speaker phone. </summary>

<summary> The present invention is a system for reducing or eliminating undersea optical repeaters in a trunk and branch ring network by using remotely pumped optical amplifiers powered by energy transmitted over the same branch cables that distribute communications signals. The network consists of a ring topology optical fiber cable trunk with telecommunications hubs and branching units serially interconnected. The hubs serve as access points for routing communications onto or from the cable trunk, while the branching units allow for add/drop points for telecommunications traffic. Light emitting power sources are used to transmit optical energy at a wavelength different from signal wavelength to power optical amplifiers located in the branch fiber optic cables, trunk, or branching units. This repeaterless technology reduces costs and improves network survivability by maintaining connectivity in the event of cable cuts and isolating only the affected branches. </summary>

The invention relates to a cover plate device for wiring devices mounted in ganged boxes on building walls, providing a finished look without exposed fasteners and allowing for easy installation and removal. The device consists of two parts - an attachment member mounted to the wiring device and a cover plate member with no visible fasteners, allowing for proper positioning over uneven walls.

<summary> The present invention relates to a collapsible light-shielding device for screens, such as television sets and monitors. The device consists of concentrically nested annular strips that can slide over each other to cover or uncover the screen. The strips have decreasing wall thickness, allowing for different viewing angles. The device can be easily attached to a screen using Velcro and is designed to be compact and unobtrusive. The invention provides a cost-effective, reliable, and easily adjustable solution for reducing glare on screens. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to automatically providing an indication to a speaker when their rate of speech exceeds a level that a listener can comprehend. The system involves detecting the speaking rate, comparing it to a listening rate threshold, and notifying the speaker to slow down if necessary. The device used for this purpose can be a wearable computing device that provides sensory feedback to the speaker. The method includes determining the language being spoken, setting a speaking rate threshold based on listener proficiency, and adjusting the speaking rate accordingly. The system can also suggest shifting the conversation to an alternative language if it would improve comprehension.</summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a device for optical recording of rapid processes with a TV camera, allowing for higher picture sequence frequencies. By deviating and suppressing the beam, the scanning beam runs successively over N lines of a picture plane. A cyclic line counter and sawtooth generator control the vertical deviation of the beam. The device offers a flexible and simple way to record rapid processes with high resolution in time. The counter can be programmed to adjust the number of lines scanned per picture, providing optimal time and spatial resolution. The device is suitable for analyzing processes that require high-speed recording, offering an alternative to expensive film cameras. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to integrating voice calls with multimedia sessions as a blended call. A multimedia server with blender software manages blended calls, using both voice and multimedia components. Incoming calls are directed to the blender if the recipient supports blended services, with voice and multimedia components handled separately. Outgoing calls from clients with blended capabilities are also processed through the blender, with signaling paths controlled by the multimedia server. The use of SIP enables access to client capabilities and facilitates call disposition handling. The methodology includes steps for incoming and outgoing voice and multimedia calls, with the blender managing the signaling paths and bearer paths of the call components. The integration of the Intelligent Network (IN) with the packet-based approach allows for mid-call activation of multimedia features. Overall, the invention prolongs the viability of existing network devices by enabling multimedia capabilities without the need for costly equipment replacement.</summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a content synchronization framework for connected devices, allowing devices to synchronize content over various network topologies. The framework involves a central reference point server, client devices, and optional partner servers. Clients send contextual information to the central reference point, which then constructs responses containing bundles of files to be synchronized. The client device creates a delta list of files to download based on the response, downloads files in priority order, and updates local copies of files. The framework supports resuming synchronization from the point of failure, employs data compression for efficient communication, and allows for caching of responses for scalability. The synchronization process involves sending requests, receiving responses, comparing local files with server files, and downloading files in order of priority until all bundles are synchronized. </summary>

<summary> The present invention provides a system and method for facilitating communication between a finder of a lost object and the owner of the object. Owners are provided with tags containing unique IDs and virtual locales, while finders can access a website to communicate anonymously with owners. Owners can register their contact information and tag IDs, view open cases, and edit their account settings. Finders can also register, view open cases, search for IDs, send messages to owners, and open new cases for found objects. The system utilizes email and messaging protocols to facilitate communication between finders and owners, ensuring the safe return of lost objects. </summary>

<summary> The invention is an electron multiplier using thin foils to create secondary electrons for amplification or detection of particles. The foils are arranged in a series within an evacuated enclosure, with an applied voltage accelerating electrons through the foils. The design allows for a higher gain per multiplication stage, simplicity and lower cost of fabrication compared to conventional multipliers. The foil electron multiplier also provides position-sensitive information and intrinsic rejection of ion feedback. Experimental results show that the foil electron multiplier has a higher gain efficiency than conventional multipliers, making it a promising advancement in electron multiplier technology. </summary>

<summary> The 3-D Phenomenoscope invention utilizes a system that allows ordinary 2-dimensional motion pictures to be viewed with a 3-dimensional effect. The system includes viewing glasses with controllable lenses, a digital sensor to capture images from the motion picture, a computer processor to process the images and identify synchronization events, and the ability to control the darkness of the lenses based on the detected motion. The algorithm used in the system detects lateral motion in the motion picture and adjusts the lenses accordingly to provide the 3-dimensional visual effect to the viewer. The system overcomes the challenges of producing, projecting, and viewing 3-dimensional motion pictures, making it a more accessible and enjoyable experience for viewers.</summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for dicing semiconductor wafers using pressure to mechanically separate individual die without a wafer saw. Trenches are formed along scribe lines on the wafer, and mechanical pressure is applied to cause a clean break along the trenches, singulating the die. The process involves applying a photo resist layer, patterning, etching trenches, applying adhesive tape, and applying pressure to the back surface of the wafer. The pressure can be applied in the X and Y directions or in a circular motion. The method improves efficiency and reduces chipping compared to traditional wafer saw methods. The invention is versatile and can be applied to various types and sizes of wafers and die. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a field emission display device with a protection structure to prevent damage to field emission elements. Field emission display devices have advantages over LCDs but are prone to damage from ionized gases. The protection structure includes reduction plates or electrodes to deflect ionized gases away from the cathode. The reduction plates can be arranged in parallel rows or in a meshwork pattern among the field emission elements. By applying a negative bias voltage to the reduction plates, the ions are deflected away from the cathode, preventing electrical surges and prolonging the lifetime of the device. The protection structure can be fabricated using photolithography techniques and deposition processes. The invention provides a cost-effective and efficient solution to prevent burnout damage in field emission display devices.</summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to an image sensor with multiple imaging planes, allowing for recording information through an edge surface of the sensor. The sensor includes a semiconductor substrate with image sensor elements on top and edge surfaces, guided by doped layers to collect charge carriers generated by light. The image sensor can be used to simultaneously image multiple planes, such as two opposing surfaces or passageways, and can be incorporated into various types of image sensors. The sensor can also be used for color applications by placing color filters over different imaging planes. Overall, the invention provides a versatile and efficient image sensor solution. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to home networks with power management systems, aiming to reduce energy consumption. Current networks struggle to enter power save mode while performing administrative functions. The proposed method transfers administrative functions from a master device to a slave device to minimize power consumption. The network master node sends data to the slave node before entering power save mode. The slave node can accept the transfer of administrative functions and become the new master node. Selection criteria for the new master node can be based on visibility or intelligence/functional capabilities. The process ensures network continuity and efficient power management. Devices can self-promote to master node if necessary. Overall, the invention optimizes network performance while reducing energy consumption. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to using antenna arrays to measure the direction of propagation of electromagnetic radiation. By arranging multiple equi-spaced triplets of antenna elements perpendicular to a ground plane, the elevation angle of signals can be accurately determined. The system uses radio interferometric techniques to combine information signals from different antennae to calculate a quotient signal independent of ground reflection coefficient. The array can be used for both receiving and transmitting modes, with applications in monitoring aircraft height and coding angles in space. The system provides unambiguous angle measurements and high measurement accuracy, with a circuit for measuring the quotient signal and a system for associating angles with identified aircraft. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to high intensity, thermal, efficient incandescent lamps, subminiature lamps, lamp assemblies, and a lamp system with a liquid tight seal. Traditional subminiature lamps use adhesive to support the glass envelope, but this can degrade from thermal cycling and exposure to cleaning procedures. The use of a polymeric seal support around the glass envelope eliminates the need for adhesive, providing extended sealing, heat resistance, and resistance to invasion and chemical attack. The polymeric seal support also helps in centering the glass envelope within the base, minimizing the number of sealing points and maximizing the length of the seal surface. Additionally, potting material can be used to minimize air volume within the lamp assembly, preventing degradation of elastomers and leads. The assembly process involves inserting the abbreviated base into the polymeric seal support, injecting potting material, and securing the electrical connections. The invention can be applied to various situations requiring insulation, heat resistance, solvent resistance, and effective sealing.</summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a technique for configuring a Generalized Decision Feedback Equalizer (GDFE) based precoder in a multi-user multiple-input multiple-output (MU-MIMO) wireless system. The technique significantly reduces computational cost while maintaining system capacity. The method involves computing filter matrices C, transmit filter matrix B, feedforward filter matrix F, and interference pre-cancellation matrix G. Different methods are presented to compute matrix C, with or without knowledge of the "Least Favorable Noise" covariance matrix S zz. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a heat-dissipating device and housing for an axial fan, aiming to increase intake airflow rate without modifying assembly conditions with other elements. The conventional fan includes a housing with an air inlet and outlet connected by a central air passage, limiting airflow. The new design extends the sidewall of the housing outward to enlarge intake and discharge areas, enhancing heat-dissipating efficiency. The impeller blade dimension can increase with the outward extension of the housing, improving airflow rate. The housing design allows for symmetrical extension at both inlet and outlet sides, with options for circular or elliptical shapes. The inclined portions in the housing guide air streams towards the center, enhancing heat dissipation efficiency. The invention can be used with a heat sink to dissipate heat from electrical elements, improving overall cooling performance. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to an electroluminescent display panel that can display images in different colors without using an intermediate electrode. The panel consists of layers laminated on a glass substrate, including first and second luminescent layers made of different materials to emit different colors. By changing the driving voltage, the panel can display images in green or a lemon color, which is a mixture of green and orange. The panel is suitable for use in instrument panels for automobiles, displaying green light at night and lemon light during the day. Different embodiments show variations in the design, such as the addition of a color filter or thicker portions on the luminescent layers to adjust luminance. The manufacturing process involves forming electrodes, insulation layers, and luminescent layers on the glass substrate. Overall, the display panel offers a simple structure and low cost solution for displaying images in different colors. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a communications terminal for Internet/network telephony, providing a low-cost alternative to traditional telephony. The terminal uses a network and/or the Internet for transferring digitized speech data. It establishes a wireless connection to a connecting unit for network access. The system includes a service server for managing connections between users and providing additional services. The method involves establishing connections, transmitting data in IP packets, and handling sound data for communication. The terminals can be earphones or headsets, providing a compact and hands-free communication solution. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a method for fabricating a structure useful in semiconductor circuitry, involving the growth of a buffer layer of non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide on a semiconductor substrate, followed by the deposition of a Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide on the buffer layer. The use of a germanium buffer layer on the semiconductor substrate helps prevent the formation of a low dielectric constant layer and allows for the epitaxial growth of high dielectric constant oxides. The integration of oxides on GaAs substrates is also facilitated by the use of a Ge buffer layer. The structure can be further enhanced by the addition of a second non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide layer and a conducting layer. Overall, the method and structure provide improved properties for semiconductor circuitry applications. </summary>

<summary>Receiver input circuits in radio and television receivers typically consist of preamplifier and mixer arrangements connected by adjustable selection means, with amplification controlled based on signal input. The use of active semiconductor components and amplification control helps balance small and large signal behavior with low production cost. The invention introduces multiple amplification control loops in the receiver input circuit to prevent signal distortion from non-linear components. The first control loop protects the mixer stage and varactor diodes, the second loop prevents overloading of the mixer stage, and a third loop with lower response threshold and bandwidth supports the other loops. The use of PIN diodes for amplification control offers advantages in protecting components and maintaining constant operating power. Additional embodiments include extended reactance networks, tunable selective circuits, and iteration-free alignment of tuning circuits. The invention aims to eliminate signal distortion while ensuring adequate small signal behavior using conventional components.</summary>

<summary> The invention relates to setting up collaborative work-sharing environments between physically distant individuals without complex setup processes. Current systems like video conferencing are expensive and require technical knowledge to operate. The proposed system involves a telephone with a collaborate indicator and button, connected to a PC on a LAN. The indicator lights up when both parties have collaboration capabilities. The system allows for spontaneous setup of shared workspaces, enabling users to share information, conduct video conferences, etc., while maintaining voice connection. The system can be implemented over the Internet, with the potential for peer-to-peer architecture and multiparty collaboration. The invention can be implemented through a computer program on various carrier mediums. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to inserting advertising clips into video sequences to optimize visual impact. The method involves generating salience maps for the video sequence and advertising clips, determining similarity between the maps, selecting the clip with the highest similarity, and inserting it at a specific point in the sequence. The device implementing this method includes memory, processing unit, input/output interface, and man-machine interface. The method can enhance the visual impact of advertising clips in video sequences by ensuring continuity in salience between the video and advertising content. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to using a recessed mask structure to prevent high electrical fields in small semiconductor devices, particularly in high speed and high density integrated circuits. As devices shrink below 150 nanometers, issues with leakage and breakdown arise due to high electrical fields at material interfaces. The invention involves positioning a mask below the surface to reduce lateral leakage current and achieve a lower effective dielectric constant. By recessing the mask, high field points are separated from the mask interface, minimizing damage to the conductive liner and reducing overall capacitance. The structure and process provide a solution to breakdown failures in devices and result in faster signal propagation in interconnect wiring. The technology allows for the formation of interconnections between difficult materials in semiconductor devices by controlling capacitance and minimizing the use of high capacitance materials.</summary>

<summary> The Downconverting Digitizer invention utilizes predictive coding principles to implement a simple down converting A/D converter, eliminating the need for complex discrete-time analog circuitry. By placing the sampler inside the predictive loop, the predictive filter can be implemented using DSP techniques, allowing for flexibility and improved dynamic range and noise performance. The dynamic range performance is further extended by utilizing the digital output of the loop to control a variable gain amplifier. An offset nuller element is incorporated to enhance DC offset performance by dynamically detecting and removing offsets during operation. The implementation example of the Downconverting Digitizer in a wireless telephone receiver demonstrated a dynamic range of over 52 dB, extendable to more than 124 dB with the AGC loop, providing high performance with reduced noise and complexity. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a method for making and using sensors with nanodimensional features that are responsive to molecular compounds, organisms, or gas molecules. The method involves fabricating arrays of semiconducting nanotraces using nanoimprint lithography, functionalizing the nanotraces with sensitizing compounds, and detecting changes in electrical characteristics of the nanotraces in response to target molecules. The sensors can be used for multiplex detection of analytes, with each sensor device having a unique anchor probe molecule for specific target detection.</summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a method of singulating and plating semiconductor packages to prevent contamination of lead surfaces. The method involves providing a leadframe with semiconductor dies, wire bonding the dies, encasing them in a molding compound, and plating the surfaces with a material that does not react with oxygen. Singulation can be done with full cutting or partial cutting using blades of different thicknesses or beveled edges. The resulting semiconductor packages have plated top, bottom, and side surfaces, with the side surfaces being straight, stepped, or beveled. Different cutting techniques can be used to achieve different side surface shapes and heights. The invention provides a new, useful, and non-obvious method for singulating and plating semiconductor packages to improve soldering results when attached to printed circuit boards. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a dual mode mobile terminal that can selectively connect to a wireless wide area network (WWAN) and a wireless local network (WLAN). The mobile terminal can switch between WWAN and WLAN based on signal strength and other factors. The WLAN gathers information about neighboring base stations from an access point, which is then used by the mobile terminal to quickly connect to the WWAN when needed. The mobile terminal has two wireless modules - one for WWAN and one for WLAN. The method allows for faster and more efficient switching between networks, reducing connection drops or delays. The system includes a mobile terminal, WWAN, and WLAN, with the mobile terminal selecting a serving base station based on the service information received from the WLAN. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a new process for producing multilayered components, such as capacitors, coils, resistances, and combinations thereof, by forming laminate sub-assemblies with electrodes and electrical components on carriers, stacking the sub-assemblies to form resultant assemblies, and fusing the electrodes during heating to create the desired electronic configurations. This process simplifies manufacturing, eliminates costly steps, allows for in-process inspection, enables the production of smaller parts with lower voltage ratings, and offers advantages such as shape flexibility, elimination of cutting stress cracks, and reduced labor content per part. The method is adaptable to various electronic ceramic devices, including multilayer ferrite inductors, semiconductor packages, precision registers, and combinations of resistors, coils, and capacitors in one stack.</summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to hierarchical lattice structures with unit cells of various sizes connected together to form lightweight lattice structures with improved specific stiffness and strength. These lattice structures can be used in sandwich panels for various applications, including impact and blast mitigation, thermal transfer, multifunctional structures, armors, and load-bearing construction materials. The lattice structures can be fabricated through injection molding processes, investment casting, and other manufacturing methods. The invention also encompasses methods for making these lattice structures, including nesting and mating arrays of unit cells, as well as applying face sheets to the lattice structures. Various applications and embodiments of the lattice structures are described, along with references to related patents and applications.</summary>

<summary> The document describes a process for co-producing power and hydrocarbons by integrating an Integrated Gasification Combined Cycle (IGCC) facility with a Coal-to-Liquid (CTL) hydrocarbon synthesis facility. The process involves gasifying coal in wet and dry gasification stages, enriching combustion gas with hydrogen, synthesizing hydrocarbons from the gas, and capturing CO2 emissions for sequestration. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a method for preparing a solid device for use as an oxide superconducting material, focusing on improving the properties of the material at the surface or portion close to the surface. The method involves coating a blocking film over the spaces or micro-holes in the surface portion of the superconducting material to prevent the removal of oxygen. Various films such as silicon nitride, silicon oxide, and aluminum can be used for this purpose. Heat treatment is then applied to control the oxygen concentration and ensure the superconducting characteristics are maintained at the surface. The method results in a highly reliable surface utilizing device, such as a Josephson element, with long-term stability and high reliability. The use of the photo-CVD method allows for precise coating and filling of micro-holes, leading to an improved, dense superconducting material. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to an apparatus for preparing foam sheet samples for microscopic examination. The apparatus includes a base structure, clamping arrangement, and a screw thread specimen advance mechanism. It allows for precise cutting of foam sheet samples without damaging the delicate cell structure. The foam sample is clamped in place and advanced through the apparatus for cutting. The apparatus enables the preparation of repetitive samples with uniform thickness and parallel cut edges. The method provided by the invention allows for the examination of cell structure in foam sheet material for quality control purposes. The apparatus facilitates the preparation of test samples for physical tests and helps establish performance criteria for different foam materials. It ensures that foam samples have at least two cut sides that are parallel, preserving the cell structure for microscopic examination. The precise cutting of foam samples allows for even transmission of light through the specimen during microscopic analysis. Overall, the invention provides a reliable and efficient method for preparing foam sheet samples for detailed examination.</summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a method and apparatus for determining the angle of inclination of seismometers on the ocean floor and for leveling seismic motion detectors. The apparatus includes a pendulum with a spring-loaded plunger to lock the detectors in place and a solenoid to release the plunger, allowing the angle of inclination to be measured. </summary>

The document describes a novel humidity sensing element for quantitatively sensing water vapor content in gaseous atmospheres. The element consists of an aluminum electrode with a porous dielectric coating impregnated with nickel particles, sealed with an ion-forming material, and overlaid with a nickel electrode. The impedance between the electrodes varies linearly with relative humidity when excited by a low voltage alternating current. The method of manufacturing the element involves anodizing, vacuum deposition of nickel particles, sealing, and vacuum deposition of the second electrode.

<summary> The invention relates to a motor assembly with a force transmission structure for a window lift system in a vehicle. The structure includes a drive plate with a Y-shaped mounting hole and a shaft with a Y-shaped toothed portion, providing stable rotation and reducing noise. The drive plate is made of engineering plastics material and has buffer holes for relief during molding. The shaft is held captive within the mounting hole by a circlip. The gear train includes a worm, worm gear, damper, and pinion for driving the window lift system. Forces exerted on the shaft form a stable triangle, allowing for quiet operation. The invention provides an improved transmission structure for efficient and noise-free operation of the window lift system. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to systems and methods for detection, identification, and monitoring of multipath signals in WCDMA systems. A mobile time reference is generated using a high frequency clock and maintained using a low frequency clock during idle mode. The system includes a free running counter that provides the mobile time reference for signal recovery and monitoring. The method improves efficiency in detecting and identifying multipath signals, reduces power consumption, and extends battery life. Overall, the invention enhances the performance of wireless communication systems by providing accurate timing references for signal processing.</summary>

<summary>Protective helmets with hard outer shells typically have a resilient liner assembly to absorb shock. Previous methods for custom-fitted liners involved complex processes or one-shot procedures. A new method involves layers of elastic thermoplastic sheets with open pockets that deform when compressed. The liner is heated, fitted to the wearer's head, and cooled to retain the shape. This process allows for rapid fitting, refitting for size changes, and eliminates the need for drawstrings. The liner conforms to the wearer's head contours, reducing shifting. The manufacturing process is simplified, and the liner does not require trimming. The helmet includes an outer shell with an energy-absorbing foam liner. The liner is secured to the shell with fasteners and can be adjusted within a specific sizing range. Overall, the individually fitted helmet liner is simple, cost-effective, and provides a comfortable and secure fit.</summary>

The invention relates to a multiorifice structure spray disc for use in automotive fuel injector valves, made by fusing concentric layers of rods and cylindrical members at progressively larger angles. The structure has triangular passageways for atomizing fuel, with the thickness of the wafer determining the directional component of the ejected fluid. The method of fabrication involves twisting rods around a core and sheathing them in cylindrical members before fusing and slicing the assembly into thin multiorifice structures. The structure's unique design enhances atomization and uniformity of apertures, offering advantages over conventional drilling or photoetching techniques.

<summary> The present invention relates to a method of manufacturing a semiconductor device, specifically an insulated gate (MOS) field effect semiconductor device with a lightly doped drain (LDD) structure. The method involves forming an insulating film on the gate electrode, forming a low density region for the source/drain by ion injection, depositing an oxide film, anisotropically etching a layer to form a portion on the gate sidewall, and forming a high density region for the source/drain by ion injection. The width of the oxide portion on the gate sidewall is controlled to improve controllability. The method also prevents degradation of transconductance and resistances due to hot-carrier injection and allows for the formation of shallow junctions. Various embodiments involve using different materials for the sidewall portion, such as polycrystalline silicon, high melting point metal, or silicides, and siliciding the gate electrode and/or the source/drain region. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to an improved end-user interface for Internet-protocol (IP) telephone communication, providing a low-cost solution with reduced speech delay. The enhanced radio telephone can operate as both a conventional wireless telephone and an improved IP telephone, connecting to a PC for streamlined telephony application. By shifting the burden of speech coding and decoding to the enhanced radio telephone, the PC can be low-cost and low-performance, providing a more convenient, economical, and efficient IP telephone solution. The system can be implemented with various configurations, including connections via cable, wireless, or integrated network interfaces, offering flexibility for different applications.</summary>

<summary> The invention relates to devices for producing electrical power from surface waves on a water body. It captures energy from submerged devices relying on wave-induced pressure differences to deform gas-filled containers. The design aims to enhance energy capture efficiency and survivability in severe sea-states. The device utilizes flexible bellows containers, surface venting, and floating bodies to increase stroke and energy capture. It overcomes limitations of prior art designs by reducing mass, increasing stroke length, and optimizing energy capture efficiency. Various embodiments include inclined surfaces, shoaling features, wave reflection walls, and multiple interconnected containers for enhanced energy capture. The design allows for depth adjustment, tidal adaptability, and efficient energy conversion from wave motion. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to scraped surface heat exchangers and the mounting of blades onto a central drive shaft. Blades are hingedly connected to the drive shaft with pins, allowing for mixing and scraping of material inside the outer tube. The new method involves locking tracks on both sides of the blade to prevent lateral movement during installation. This method facilitates the mounting process, ensures correct orientation of the blade, and prevents blades from falling off during vertical installation. The design also reduces wear on blades and pins, improving overall performance and longevity of the heat exchanger. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a process and apparatus for detecting and eliminating defective or incorrectly positioned cigarettes in a cigarette magazine of a production or packaging machine. The process involves using optical checking elements to detect images of cigarettes, which are then evaluated by an image-processing device to produce an error signal if deviations are found. An apparatus includes cameras, image-processing devices, and ejecting units to automatically eject defective cigarettes. The process and apparatus can also detect and eliminate other defects in cigarettes, such as missing filters or bent cigarettes. The ejecting units are designed to prevent jamming and can be manually or automatically actuated to eject defective cigarettes. The system includes multiple cameras, evaluation zones, and ejecting zones to efficiently detect and eliminate defects. The combination of automatic detection and ejection of defective cigarettes provides significant advantages in cigarette production or packaging machines. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a device for connecting high voltage cables with apparatus or other cables, using a common connection system for all applications. The system includes different interface methods such as inner cone, outer cone, or plane surfaces. The components include cable terminations with stress relief cones and rigid insulators with conical interface surfaces. Various applications of the invention are illustrated, including SF6 terminals, transformer terminals, outdoor terminals, straight through joints, transition joints, and joints between apparatus. The design allows for factory pretesting, reduced installation time and cost, and simplified field testing. The outer surface configuration of the rigid insulator is crucial for high operating reliability in high voltage installations. </summary>

The invention relates to a fixing mechanism for a tool used in machining, particularly in cutting, punching, molding, and forming work. The fixing mechanism involves curved connecting surfaces in the tool frame and tool holder, allowing for simple and secure tool fixation. The mechanism can be used in various applications, including machining metal sheets in sheet machining centers.

<summary> The invention relates to switching circuitry for driving display drivers with high speed and low EMI output. Traditional charge pump circuits and switching regulator circuits have limitations in terms of current driving capability and EMI generation. The present invention provides a modified switching regulator circuit with interleaved source and drain paths to cancel out EMI. Additional terminal paths are added to further reduce EMI effects. The invention allows for efficient generation of current to drive large displays without the typical EMI issues associated with such circuits. </summary>

<summary>Vehicle battery rebalancing is performed to correct cell voltage imbalance conditions by measuring cell voltages and bleeding down cells to equalize them.
